body.title: Understanding Quantum Computing
body.subTitle: Quantum Mechanics and Computation
body.desc: To dive into quantum computing, start by understanding the principles of quantum mechanics such as superposition, entanglement, and quantum gates. These concepts form the backbone of quantum computation.

list.text: Superposition allows quantum bits (qubits) to exist in multiple states simultaneously.
Entanglement enables qubits to be interconnected, allowing instant state correlations regardless of distance.
Quantum gates manipulate qubit states, enabling complex computational processes.

body.title: Learn Quantum Algorithms
body.subTitle: Key Algorithms in Quantum Computing
body.desc: Explore well-known quantum algorithms such as Shor's algorithm for factoring and Grover's algorithm for search optimization. These algorithms showcase the potential power of quantum computation.

list.text: Shor's algorithm can efficiently factorize large numbers, threatening classical encryption.
Grover's algorithm accelerates unstructured search processes by providing quadratic speedups.
Quantum Fourier Transform is a core component of many quantum algorithms.

body.title: Experiment with Quantum Hardware
body.subTitle: Simulators and Real Devices
body.desc: Use quantum simulators or access real quantum computers via cloud platforms like IBM Quantum, Google Quantum AI, or Rigetti Computing. Hands-on experience is invaluable for grasping quantum computing concepts.

list.text: IBM Quantum Experience offers access to real quantum devices and simulators.
Google's Sycamore processor achieved quantum supremacy by solving tasks beyond classical capabilities.
Rigetti's platform provides hybrid quantum-classical solutions for practical applications.
